name: pressurepaths
title: Pressurepaths

fields.name: tag_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the tag. Foreign key to [`tags.tag_id`](/GeoLocator-DP/core/tags#tag_id).

fields.name: datetime
fields.description: Date and time of the pressure measurement. Formatted as an ISO 8601 string with timezone designator `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ`.

fields.name: stap_id
fields.description: Identifier of the stationary period. Foreign key to [`staps.stap_id`](/GeoLocator-DP/geopressurer/staps#stap_id). A main different with `pressurepath` is that `stap_id` can have decimal value indicating a pressure measurement taken while in migration between two 'integer' stationary periods.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
One of:
 - `tag`: Create with [`tag2path()`](https://raphaelnussbaumer.com/GeoPressureR/reference/tag2path) from a likelihood map.
 - `most_likely`: Created with [`graph_most_likely()`](https://raphaelnussbaumer.com/GeoPressureR/reference/graph_most_likely.html)
- `simulation`: created by [`graph_simulation()`](https://raphaelnussbaumer.com/GeoPressureR/reference/graph_simulation): 
- `geopressureviz`: created by [`geopressureviz()`](https://raphaelnussbaumer.com/GeoPressureR/reference/geopressureviz).

fields.name: ind
fields.description: Indices of the 2D coordinate of the spatial map defined in [`GeoPressureR::tag_set_map()`](https://raphaelnussbaumer.com/GeoPressureR/reference/tag_set_map) (see also [`GeoPressureR::map_expand()`](https://raphaelnussbaumer.com/GeoPressureR/reference/map_expand). Useful to retrieve information on the graph (e.g. [`GeoPressureR::path2edge()`](https://raphaelnussbaumer.com/GeoPressureR/reference/path2edge). This value is the main way to create a path in GeoPressureR through [`GeoPressureR::ind2path()`](https://raphaelnussbaumer.com/GeoPressureR/reference/ind2path).

fields.name: j
fields.description: Only useful for `paths.type='simulation'`. Unique identifier for each trajectory, integer from `1` to `nj` as defined in [`GeoPressureR::graph_simulation()`](https://raphaelnussbaumer.com/GeoPressureR/reference/graph_simulation)`.
